title: proposed /remake rework
body:
let's face it. /remake is punishing people with connection issues more than legitimate ragequitters / afks. and is unfairly harsh for what's essentially a game that never happened. 

MY SOLUTION.
treat it the same as a dodge penalty. rather than taking a full loss, and change the reconnect {{champion:412}} hold to 5 minutes instead of 3

replies.body:
Don't take this the wrong way, But "Connection issues" is just an excuse.

There is no way for RIOT or any one here to know why you "disconnected" in the first place.

So honestly, why are you having connection issue? Bad internet? shared internet? Bad router or modem? **Fix those first**

League is an online multiplayer game, pretty sure it's common sense to have a decent connection before starting any game or match.

There are sites online you can go to check your ping/connection strength. Not ideal? don't play. simple.

Want to play even though your likely to DC? Play custom or coop vs ai, where it doesn;t matter if you leave or quit. and if DC while in coop, at least the AI will have on champ afk to compensate.

So again, why are you disconnecting? and please don't blame RIOT or the League client, a lot more people are connecting to the game just fine.

The /remake was never intended for ragequits or afkers. It is intended to let you restart games that started with one team at a disadvantage. It is a full loss because if it weren't then you could abuse it.

Before remake, I never reported someone who never connected because it's usually something that's not their fault. This post isn't saying allow it for rage quitters, they're saying the people who do it to rage quit are worse than the people who flat out can't connect, so the can't connect shouldn't be punished as harshly as the rage quitters.

As far as abuse, if they didn't want to play that game, they know they had the option to que dodge and not waste additional time for the game to load and the team to vote to remake.
